CreditLine: Acquired by William T. or Henry Walters
Description: A black standard (oblong) three compartment inro. On one side a lily in inlaid raden, the leaves in "takamakie" in silver. A butterfly in "takamakie" in gold flying just above the lily. A plant with red lacquer leaves in the background. Part of the butterfly's wing is at the top of the inro. All on a black "roiro" lacquer ground. Another lily on the reverse whose leaves circle around to the other side. The cord channels are internal. The interior in "fundame" of gold.

Exhibitions.ExhTitle: From Rye to Raphael: The Walters Story

Keywords: plant; fern; flower; lily; animal; insect; butterfly
Medium: gold and silver lacquer and shell

Title: Inro with White Lily
